paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.187C>T (p.P63S) and associated penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: bilateral leg edema, shortness of breath, atrial fibrillation, concentric LV hypertrophy, severe ATTR amyloid deposits
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We suspected the patient of having ATTRwt amyloidosis, as he showed an elderly-onset sporadic cardiac phenotype.

functional_data.summary: In silico analyses predicted that the p.P63S variant only modestly altered the structure and function of the TTR protein.
assays: bioinformatics tools (SIFT, Polyphen2, Mutation Tester, CADD)
LC-MS/MS analysis of cardiac amyloid deposits

variants.segregation_data: The possibility that this patient had a de novo variant could not be excluded, since the parents were unavailable for testing.
variants.population_frequency: The c.187C>T (p.P63S) variant has not been described in disease-causing variant databases or healthy individual databases.
variants.evidence_level: modestly pathogenic based on in silico analyses and LC-MS/MS findings
variants.additional_notes: The P63 amino acid is conserved across mammalian species.
key_quotes: The c.187C>T (p.P63S) variant has not been described in disease-causing variant databases.
The cardiac amyloid was predominantly composed of the variant TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted from the main text.
